results.title: Coals Coals (Horses and Carts)
results.creator_credit: Francis Gysin, National Coal Board and David Pitt
results.brief_description: The last of the horse-drawn delivery drays of Charringtons. The film is a nostalgic record of the work of the horses and delivery men. There is no glamour, the stables are scruffy, the men dirty, but the horses are immaculate. The title comes from a music-hall song which provides the background music.

results.title: Coal: the rock that burns
results.brief_description: Discusses the formation of coal, its location throughout the world, types of coal, mining, reclaiming stripminded land and the by-products of coal. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Coal valley
results.creator_credit: Derek Wright, New Zealand National Film Unit and Conon Fraser
results.brief_description: Presents the case for small scale private mining by examining the independence, ingenuity and engineering skill of the men who built and work five small privately owned coal mines on the west coast of New Zealand’s South Island. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Coal Power
results.brief_description: Includes “Power from the Valley”, outlining the process of brown coal mining in the La Trobe Valley and its eventual consumption in a turbine generator. (12 min) “Demolition of Yallourn Briquette Chimney” looks at the demolition of the historic briquette production plant at yallourn. Directed by Jim Hayes. (4 min) “The Timeless Force” is a history of the harnessing of energy and its eventual application by the SEC. Gives a history of the SEC’s early years. This film narrated by John Stanton. (29 min)
results.description: Includes “Power from the Valley”, outlining the process of brown coal mining in the La Trobe Valley and its eventual consumption in a turbine generator. results.creator_credit: New Realm and Great Britain. Ministry of Information

results.title: Coal Miner's Daughter
results.creator_credit: Bernard Schwartz, Universal Pictures and Michael Apted
results.brief_description: Based on the autobiography of the same name by country and western legend Loretta Lynn, the film traces her beginnings in the Appalachia backwoods, her marriage when still a child, and her eventual arrival in Nashville. From there she launches her career and becomes one of America’s most successful recording artists. The film is notable for its evocative depiction of poverty in the Deep South, and the winning portrayal of Lynn by Sissy Spacek (who won an Academy Award for her role). Cast also includes Tommy Lee Jones, Levon Helm and Beverly D’Angelo in a cameo as Patsy Cline. The soundtrack features a selection of country and western classics.

results.title: Coal from Westland
results.brief_description: Coal mining in the forest mountain of Westland, New Zealand. Shows miners at work in coal pits, at home with their families and enjoying leisure hours. The camera explores the rugged beauty of the mountains and deep gorges surrounding the mines.

results.title: Coal Dust the Invisible Killer
results.brief_description: High productivity at the coalface means increased dust, a major health hazard to the miner. Using diagrams and an actual lung a doctor explains how and what diseases are caused by prolonged exposure to coal dust, and answers key questions of concern to every miner. Strong emphasis is given to suppressing dust at source through effective ventilation and water sprays, combines with statutory monitoring of dust, regular X-Ray and medical examinations. Protection today prevents pneumoconiosis tomorrow.
